oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Management of Dystocia in Camelids
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tibary, A.
Rodriguez, J. S.
Anouassi, A.
Walker, P.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Dystocia
camelid
parturition
obstetrical situations
prepartum
uterine torsion
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dystocia is the most common emergency in camelid practice. The aim of the present paper is to review the most important clinical features of normal parturition and to discuss obstetrical situations in camelids and their non-surgical and surgical management, including prepartum and term uterine torsion. This clinical review includes both Old and New World camelids.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2008; 166-176
